headline: Kotak UPI RuPay Virtual Credit Card: Who can apply and how to get it instantly
intro: Kotak Mahindra Bank?s UPI-linked RuPay Virtual Credit Card offers instant approval, lifetime free usage, UPI integration, and rewards, aligning with RBI?s push for seamless digital credit transactions.
imagecaption: Kotak UPI RuPay Credit Card enables secure, reward-driven digital payments through UPI without the need for a physical card.

headline: These five private banks in India have the lowest NPAs. Should you invest?
intro: From an investment perspective, picking banks with low NPAs translates into a more stable and predictable earnings stream, a vital consideration when seeking reliable returns.
imagecaption: NPAs or non-performing assets are loans and advances given by a bank to its customers that are default or close to being in default. (Image: Pixabay)

headline: India's PSU banks outshine private peers in arresting bad loans
intro: PSU banks not only saw a decline in fresh slippages in FY25 but also witnessed healthy recoveries and upgrades. Will the recovery continue going ahead?
imagecaption: Bad loans of PSU banks decreased 16% year-on-year in FY25, (Image: Pixabay)

headline: Kotak Mahindra Bank elevates Paritosh Kashyap to exec director; Shanti Ekambaram to retire on Oct 31
intro: Kotak Mahindra Bank said that Shanti Ekambaram, Deputy Managing Director, will be retiring from her role effective October 31, 2025, upon completion of her current term.
imagecaption: Kotak Mahindra Bank,Saket,New Delhi. PIC:MADHU KAPPARATH

headline: Growth seen holding up as March quarter zips at 7.4%
intro: Both figures were lower than year-on-year (y-o-y) compared to FY24, when Q4 recorded 7.8%, and full-year FY24 recorded GDP growth of 9.2% (revised).
imagecaption: Chief economic advisor V. AnanthaNageswaran said India's steady, low-inflation growth condition is also leading to a record tightening of India's 10-year bond yield vis-a-vis the US 10-year treasury note yield.

headline: How to get  ?3.5 lakh personal loan from Kotak Bank in just a few clicks
intro: Kotak Mahindra Bank offers personal loans up to  ?35 lakh and higher with easy eligibility, quick approval, and digital application at competitive interest rates.
imagecaption: Kotak Bank offers easy personal loan access online with fast approval and minimal documentation.

headline: HDFC Bank, Axis to Kotak Bank: Why did ICICI Sec downgrade these top private lenders? Explained
intro: Dalal Street darlings HDFC Bank, Axis Bank, and Kotak Mahindra Bank have just been downgraded by leading domestic brokerage ICICI Securities from 'Buy' to 'Add' amid weaker near-term performance expectations, especially around earnings growth.
imagecaption: HDFC Bank, Axis to Kotak Bank: Why did ICICI Sec downgrade these top private lenders? Explained

headline: Why the bond market is unfazed by a 22-year-low yield gap
intro: Typically, when the yield gap shrinks, FPIs sell Indian bonds and invest in US bonds for risk-free returns. However, in recent years, India's sharply improving fiscal deficit and slowing inflation meant that Indian bond yields stayed stable while US yields spiked.
imagecaption: Domestic macro stability is expected to shield India from any major outflows.

headline: Shares to buy: Tata Motors to Kotak Bank - Prashanth Tapse suggests 3 stocks to buy in the short term
intro: Shares to buy: Prashanth Tapse recommends buying these three stocks in the short term - Tata Motors, Titagarh Rail Systems, and Kotak Mahindra Bank.
imagecaption: Shares to buy: Prashanth Tapse recommends buying these three stocks in the short term - Tata Motors, Titagarh Rail Systems, and Kotak Mahindra Bank.

headline: In Q4, banks sailed through a tough quarter. But choppy waters await
intro: Indian banks, such as ICICI and HDFC Bank, are showing remarkable resilience in a tough environment. Bank valuations, too, are near 10-year averages, offering a margin of safety. But there could be some ?unknown unknown? lurking in the shadows.
imagecaption: Macroeconomic headwinds and the resultant slowdown in credit growth have been weighing on the domestic banking sector for the past few quarters.
